labels.name: good first issue

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
See the comments in https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/pull/8814/files#diff-e02b5aa2806cf9086c18c4d38b880df457d9313bf02ba108d58e67336abbab66 - those should be fixed in the individual `changelog/*.rst` files.

Ignore the first comment about the title, that's tracked in #8817.

body: If all else fails, we could always patch this manually in the release PR. But let's take a quick look if we can figure out where this comes from and fix this there.
i recall having the same issue in xdist and before in prance - i suspect its a towncrier bug

I think this is a towncrier problem @The-Compiler , I noticed it when trying to setup TC on another project recently, will investigate this tomorrow.  Possibly: https://github.com/twisted/towncrier/issues/346 (out of time to do anything more tonight).
Yay, thanks! Note I'll be mostly afk for the next 3 weeks.

issue.title: Fix towncrier output

labels.name: needs backport
labels.description: applied to PRs, indicates that it should be ported to the current bug-fix branch

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
Add top line to towncrier template

Looks correct now:

```rst
.. towncrier release notes start

pytest 7.0.0 (2021-08-27)
=========================


Breaking Changes
----------------

- `#8246 <https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/8246>`_: ``--version`` now writes version information to ``stdout`` rather than ``stderr``.
[...]
```
    
Fixes #8817, supersedes #9045 and also includes the changelog commit cherry-picked from there.

See https://github.com/twisted/towncrier/issues/346 and https://github.com/twisted/towncrier/issues/340.
